Articles.Content:
So, about a month or two ago, I switched to using Open Broadcaster Software to record my YouTube videos. And I immediately found that OBS doesn't REALLY record at full resolution.

Here's a screencap I took of an OBS video where I recorded my monitor.

The biggest image is the actual window the video player is in. It's the ACTUAL resolution of my monitor, or at least after Imgur processing.

The next image down is what OBS saw of itself. Notice the considerable drop in resolution? Yeah, that's what this thread is about.

Anyone know how to fix the resolution issues?

My monitor is 1280x1024 (not a widescreen).

Edited January 28, 2016 by UnionPacific1983WP
Anyone with knowledge of OBS know how to fix this? Sorry for the bump but I really need help with this.
I think, some presets come with scaling predefined. You'll need to dig through the settings and see if you can find the actual fields that define it.
@UnionPacific1983WP: If you go into the settings and video, you can change the scaled resolution.  It scales it for live streaming.
